subject: Re: [junit] Proposed parameterized test syntax for JUnit 4
msgSnippet: Hi David, ... I m not sure I see the connection between a new instance per method call and parameters for test methods . How does one exclude the other?
messageBody:
Hi David,

On 10/5/05, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Cedric,
>
> I think there's a lot of room for different ways of organizing tests.
> For me, it's good for JUnit 4 to keep the one-class-instance-per-test
> philosophy of JUnits 1 through 3. I find that if my code depends on too
> much global state, or too many collaborators, I begin to feel it,
> because it gets harder to test in JUnit. I find that if I ignore this
> pain in the tests, eventually it becomes a pain in the code, so I like
> JUnit's early warning.


I'm not sure I see the connection between "a new instance per method call"
and "parameters for test methods". How does one exclude the other?

With that in mind, I find that having the parameters on the constructor
> reminds me of what's really going on.


Probably a personal thing, then.

I know I prefer:

// no constructor needed
public void validateXml(String xmlPath) { ... }
public void verifyApplicationIsDeployed(URL url) { ... }

over

public MyTest(String xmlPath, URL url) { ... }
public void validateXml() { ... }
public void verifyApplicationIsDeployed() { ... }


--
Cédric
